text: [BELL RINGING]
Business School, are you here?
[CHEERING]
[MUSIC PLAYING]

Class of 2017,
friends, and family,

and members of the Harvard
Business School community,
good afternoon and welcome.

I want to offer some
parting thoughts

specific to the challenging
times in which we
find ourselves.

I'm going to talk to
you about three Rs.

They are responsibility,
reach, and respect.

You are graduating
into a world in which

trust and faith in business
has declined significantly.

Simply put, many view
the capitalist system
in deep need of repair.

As leaders, part of
your responsibility

is to rebuild this trust
between business and society.
[CHEERING]

The way that you can do so is
by creating shared prosperity.

Some businesses
have already begun

to lead the way on
such issues including

living wages, equal
rights, and sustainability.

If you want your lives to
have that kind of impact,
you must reach.

When we reach, we take a
risk that has the potential

to fundamentally
shift the trajectory

of our lives and
our organizations,
and of other people.

Finally, I ask you to consider
a third vital behavior--
that of respect.

As leaders, you will often get
more credit than you deserve.

Be sure to share this credit
by giving respect to all
who contribute to any success.
[CHEERING]
[APPLAUSE]
